thread.title: Seahawks center Drew Nowak will start against the 49ers in place of injured Patrick Lewis
thread.title_full: Seahawks center Drew Nowak will start against the 49ers in place of injured Patrick Lewis | The Seattle Times

author: Jayson Jenks
title: Seahawks center Drew Nowak will start against the 49ers in place of injured Patrick Lewis
text:
RENTON — Drew Nowak will once again start at center for the Seahawks against the San Francisco 49ers just one week after losing the job, coach Pete Carroll said.
Nowak started the first five games at center this season but lost the job last week to Patrick Lewis. But Lewis is out with an ankle injury.
Carroll also said left tackle Garry Gilliam would play against the 49ers, meaning the Seahawks will have the same starting line they had through the first five weeks of the season.
Here are the other injury updates:
Linebacker Bobby Wagner (pectoral), defensive end Frank Clark (hamstring) and cornerback Tye Smith (hip) are all expected back after missing last week’s game. Fullback Derrick Coleman (concussion) won’t play against the 49ers. Coleman suffered the concussion in a two-car accident in Bellevue last week. The Seahawks will also be without defensive tackle Jordan Hill (quad), cornerback Marcus Burley (hand) and linebacker Nick Moody (ankle) again. Carroll said Burley is expected to return next week. Defensive tackle Demarcus Dobbs is listed on the official injury report as questionable with a shoulder injury. Cornerback Richard Sherman showed up on Tuesday’s injury report as not practicing because of an ankle injury, but Carroll said Sherman would play in San Francisco. Linebacker Brock Coyle had surgery on his knee, Carroll said. The Seahawks placed Coyle on the Injured Reserve list with the designated to return label. That means Coyle can return to practice in six weeks and return to games in eight weeks.
